intro: Cheiranthus lanatus, commonly known as the woolly wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. Cheiranthus lanatus is often found in coastal areas and can tolerate coastal conditions such as salt spray and strong winds.
